description: Part single storey rear infill extension; first floor rear/side extension; conversion of garage into a workshop; alterations of front elevation incorporating a window in lieu of a garage door; and replacement rear terrace (with associated glass balustrade and privacy screens)(replacing existing wooden terrace).
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the drawings: Proposed Ground and First Floor Plans drawing no. A671/P01A, Proposed Loft and Roof Plan drawing no.A671/P02, Proposed Elevations A671/P03A and Proposed Sections drawing no.A671/P04A
REASON: For avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall complement the appearance of those of the existing property and shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition 2.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the existing building and surrounding area in accordance with National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - sections 12 and 16, policies D1 and D4 of the London Plan 2021, 1.1 and 1.2 of the Local Development Framework (Core) Strategy (2012); and 7B and 7.4 of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013).
| No part of the roof of the extension shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013 and National Planning Policy Framework 2019 - section 12 - Achieving well-designed places.

| The workshop area shall only be used for purposes incidental to the enjoyment of the development hereby approved and shall not be used or adapted as an independent any industrial, commercial or business use.

REASON: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties  and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan 2021 and the Hanwell Village Green Management Plan(2008)
| No new openings to the extension notwithstanding approved plans as per Condition 2, shall be incorporated without prior written confirmation from the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D1, D4 and of the London Plan 2021, policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1 and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012
| No new openings to the extension notwithstanding approved plans as per Condition 2, shall be incorporated without prior written confirmation from the Local Planning Authority.

REASON: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D1, D4 and of the London Plan 2021, policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1 and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012

| The proposed first floor flank window facing no.36 Manor Court Road shall incorporate stained/etched glass as per approved plans Condition 2  and only have top openings at a minimum of 1.7m from floor level and remain in perpetuity.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D1, D2 and D4 of the London Plan 2021,  policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
| TThe proposed privacy screen (2m fence adjacent to no.32 Manor Court Road) and as per approved plans Condition 2 shall remain in perpetuity.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of nearby properties in accordance with policies D1, D2 and D4 of the London Plan 2021, policies 7.4, 7A & 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and polices 1.1 (e)(g), 1.2 (f), 2.1(c) and 2.10 Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012.
